title: Dad found newborn baby dead after she fell asleep on his chest
text:
Jake Olive said he lay baby Chantilley down on his chest to soothe her but woke to find her unresponsive (Picture: iStockphoto)

A new father ‘woke with a jolt’ to find his three-day-old daughter lying lifeless on his chest, an inquest heard.

Jake Olive had been watching Netflix with partner Chantilley when their baby, also named Chantilley, started fidgeting in her Moses basket.

In a bid to calm her, he scooped her out, carried her over to the sofa and lay her down on his chest where she then nodded off.

But around half an hour later he woke suddenly and realised his daughter was unresponsive.

In a statement read during an inquest at Archbishops’ Palace in Maidstone, Mr Olive said: ‘The TV had gone black form the programme having finished and I was aware I had woken up with a jolt but there was no similar reaction from Chantilley.

Advertisement

‘My partner woke with a start asking what was wrong and I told her Chantilley wasn’t breathing and to ring for an ambulance.’

The coroners’ court heard how Mr Olive began CPR while they waited for paramedics to reach their home, in Sittingbourne, in the early hours of April 21.

‘I had the telephone on loud speaker in front of me and was speaking to the operator, who confirmed I knew what I was doing,’ Mr Olive’s statement continued.

‘I told her I had done this once before.’

But despite his best efforts, along with those of the paramedics, ambulance crews and doctors, Chantilley died at Medway Maritime Hospital at around 5am that morning.

‘No matter me continuing, I just couldn’t unblock what was inside her in order to get her breathing,’ Mr Olive said.

He recalled having to ‘step outside as it all got too much’ after a seconds ambulance crew took over CPR.

The cause of death was put down to Sudden Unexpected Death in Infancy (SUDI) – usually given where no exact cause can be pinpointed.

‘Assistant Coroner Catherine Wood said: ‘The difficulty we have is in relation to the pathologist’s cause of death.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Sudden Unexpected Death in Infancy (SUDI) is essentially a term for indicating the cause of death is unknown.

‘Medical science isn’t yet able to pinpoint what happens in certain deaths.

‘What happens in certain deaths still can’t be explained and as a result, the only alternatives are for me to reach an open conclusion or a narrative conclusion.’

The coroner accepted the ‘proposed cause of death as SUDI’ and recorded the short narrative conclusion: ‘Chantilley Olive died on April 21, 2019, and no clear medical cause of death could be established at post-mortem.’

description: Jake Olive lay baby Chantilley on his chest to soothe her, but woke from a short nap to find she had mysteriously died in her sleep.
